SOURCE ID: Author/Org, Date, Info: Nair 2012; Nair, P. K. R. (2012). Climate change mitigation: a low-hanging fruit of agroforestry. In Agroforestry-The future of global land Use (pp. 31-67). Springer, Dordrecht.
Assumptions: Excluded as the current year adoption is required for 2018

SOURCE ID: Author/Org, Date, Info: Project Drawdown 2018, calculated based on the sum of regional values
Assumptions: Refer current adoption-silvopasture sheet - excluded for now because the calculations do not account for silvopasture adoption in eastern europe, asia and africa

SOURCE ID: Author/Org, Date, Info: den Herder et al. 2017; current adoption based on satellite data; den Herder, Michael, et al. "Current extent and stratification of agroforestry in the European Union." Agriculture, Ecosystems & Environment 241 (2017): 121-132.
Assumptions: excluded as current adoption is required for the globe

SOURCE ID: Author/Org, Date, Info: Lal 2018; Lal, R., Smith, P., Jungkunst, H. F., Mitsch, W. J., Lehmann, J., Nair, P. R., ... & Skorupa, A. L. (2018). The carbon sequestration potential of terrestrial ecosystems. Journal of Soil and Water Conservation, 73(6), 145A-152A.
Project Drawdown 2019, calculated based on percent silvopasture area (Variable 31) to the total pasture/grazing land area (Variable 29)
Assumptions: Based on averages for Variables 30 and 31
